ygData.subject: Re: New Songs
ygData.msgSnippet: the level 50 song is called Verses of Victory, but it doesn t say who wrote it =P  i am guessing Vilia, who also wrote Verses of Celerity. i am assuming the
ygData.messageBody:
the level 50 song is called Verses of Victory, but it doesn't say who wrote
it =P i am guessing Vilia, who also wrote Verses of Celerity.

i am assuming the fact that Desperate Dirge hurts yourself also has to be a
bug. it is supposed to be a desparation song, so using it should not kill
yourself, since you would be low on health when you use it!

my other bard friend suggested using Curtailing Chant before one of the
tuyens songs to lower the mob's magic resistance thus making chant of flame
not get resisted, and she said it worked pretty well. plus you can stack
the fufil's and tuyen's chant songs to do some decent DoT damage.

by the way, no new songs in erudin, just level 43 and 50 in freeport and
qeynos.

Shada Silverleaf, Level 48 Bard, Mithaniel Marr
Erisi, Level 6 Paladin, Mithaniel Marr


> -----Original Message-----
> From: jhenders@... [mailto:jhenders@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, June 30, 1999 9:49 AM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] New Songs
>
>
> From: jhenders@...
>
> Actually those 2 showed up a few patches ago. We appear to have gotten
> the promised L43 song Desperate Dirge, and a L50 song, whose name I
> forgot to write down. (sorry) I managed to check everywhere but Erudin
> last night so there may be more.
>
> On the Dirge, it will also damage you as well as the monsters it's
> targetting, so watch it if you attempt to actually use it if you are
> desperate and low on health. It took about a RL hour to fully
> regain my
> mana after using the song.
>
> The various chants supposedly had their damage increased, but at least
> on testing on myself, it appears that it has actually decreased. Chant
> of Flame used to do about 30, 10 over 3 ticks. Now it appears
> to do 22,
> 11 over 2 ticks. Also, Chant of Flame, at least, appears to
> be resisted
> so much that I'm finding it questionable whether it's worth keeping
> loaded. Like many spells that have 2 effects, it appears that this
> doubles the chance for the mob to resist the song, and in my tests
> yesterday, I rarely saw it actually take. It's too bad too, because if
> we bards could lower fire resistance significantly it would allow the
> higher level Druid's who've been complaining that their only good in
> dungeon direct damage spells were useless to have a better chance of
> hitting too.
>
> On Wed, Jun 30/99, G2 Dan <drockwell@...> wrote:
> > From: "G2 Dan" <drockwell@...>
> >
> >
> > I recall seeing a chant of flame and a chant of frost in
> the Freeport guild
> > last nite, all high, way up there, you'll make it someday
> level though..
> > theres a few others as well.
>
> > > From: Abhi Visuvasam <abhi_1999@...>
> > >
> > > Greetings,
> > >
> > > Can anybody tell me what new songs the patch delivered
> > > to the vendors?
>
